Matchmaking is 100% unplayable, even after f2p prime got removed.
You get cheaters at least every other match. If met a guy on a CS discord, who openly admitted to cheating,
he didnt even really try to hide it, gets called a cheater and reported in pretty mutch every matchs he plays.
Yet he has no red trest factor, thanks to botted recommendations, and has been cheating for over 5 months now with no ban. (I've met him 4 months ago and been checking his account once in a while to see if he finally got banned). 

Valve is printing money thanks to keys and the steam market tax, but still puts basically 0 effort in anti-cheat.

After having played Counter-Strike for a very, very long time, starting back at 1.5, and having enjoyed many hours of gameplay in CS:GO, I honestly cannot recommend this game anymore after all the unfortunate changes made to it.

The developers are trying to do the right thing by listening to the community, but at times they have listened to the wrong people and destroyed beloved parts of their game.

The move to F2P also did not help, it rarely does with any game.

CS:GO used to be amazing, it was really sad to experience it changing into a more and more newbie friendly casual game.
